list_definition.definition: to separate by passing through a sieve etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Sift the flour before making the cake.

list_ex_of_english: I welcome the proposals for the giving of training and for the supplying of legal assessors to help the magistrate in sifting the evidence.
Withers sifts the evidence carefully to show the dynamics of this transformation.
Nothing will put that right but a real sifting examination into our fundamental ideas of education.
Nevertheless, it may be claimed that the facts collected have been carefully sifted, the references conscientiously verified, and the opposing theories honestly presented.
I want that evidence sifted upstairs in a formal, legal manner.
Had we known about them earlier it might have been possible to have included the sifting operation in the other operations.
I should like to see the local authorities made the sifting machine of these claims.
All those appointed were experienced at sifting through complex issues and coming to reasonable conclusions based on evidence presented to them.
